entry.title: Angel Beaded Ornament
entry.summary:
Vendor: Global Mamas, Ghana
Type: each
Price: 18.95

Beads made from recycled glass. Wire framework and loop for hanging. Raffia tie.

Handmade in Ghana by Global Mamas.

Bead making has been a thriving industry in West Africa since the sixteenth century and the Krobo area of Ghana is known as one of the beadmaking hubs. The handcrafting of beads using clay molds and ovens has changed little over the centuries as the family craft is passed down through the generations. In Krobo, beads are handmade from all kinds of recycled glass such as bottles, jars, and broken windows. Krobo beads are widely known for their vibrant colours and high level of craftsmanship.

      Global Mamas, GHANA

Global Mamas provides women in Ghana, West Africa the opportunity to improve their standard of living with dignity by promoting their traditional crafts. Proceeds go directly to the women participating in the Global Mamas Cooperative (all are paid over 10 times the minimum wage) and to support other non-profit programs. WFTO and FTF member.

entry.title: Christmas Tree Ornaments
entry.summary:
Vendor: Bridge of Hope, Peru
Type: each
Price: 7.95

Handmade by artisans in Peru. Bridge of Hope builds bridges between artisans and socially responsible consumers. 3.5" tall, 9 cm.

  BRIDGE OF HOPE, PERU

Bridge of Hope is confronting the root causes of poverty by providing an alternative way of doing business, in order that the artisans from the most impoverished areas of the country have opportunity for development and direct access to markets. They promote Fair Trade in order to offer the producers and artisans of Peru acceptable social and labor conditions and a just wage for their work. WFTO member.

About the artisans:

The members of Jupa are neighbours and live in the slums of Pamplona Alta, the highest part of the district of San Juan de Miraflores, which is a very arid area south of Lima. The members of Jupa are young mothers and hope to improve their livelihoods through their Fair Trade work.

 Bridge of Hope video with Jupa

entry.title: Heart Garland
entry.summary:
Vendor: Prokritee, Bangladesh
Type: Each
Price: 25.00

 Back in stock! These beautiful heart garlands are made with upcycled cotton saris, handmade in Bangladesh by Prokritee, a fair trade enterprise supporting over 1,500 artisans in rural areas.

Hang or display them anywhere, anytime - not just Valentine's Day - and feel the love! 48" l, 3" w. WFTO member. www.prokritee.com

entry.title: Butterfly Angel Ornament
entry.summary:
Vendor: UPAVIM, Guatemala
Type: each
Price: 5.95

These eco-friendly butterfly angel ornaments are handmade and Fair Trade. Their wings are made from recycled aluminum soda cans and they're outfitted in hand-woven Guatemalan fabric. Each sold separately. 2 1/2" W (wingspan) 2 1/2"H 100% Recycled Aluminum Wings 100% Cotton Fabric Assorted Colours - White, Yellow, Blue, Red, Green

15 cm H

  UPAVIM, Guatemala

UPAVIM is a group of 65 marginalized women artisans living near Guatemala City. Fair Trade sales provide sustainable incomes, a medical and dental clinic, an elementary school and daycare, 625 school scholarships, and much more. FTF member.

entry.title: Batik Greeting Cards
entry.summary:
Vendor: New Sadle, Nepal
Type: 100 gm
Price: 3.95

Traditional Nepali handmade papermaking highlight these interesting greeting cards. Made from the inner bark of a wild understory shrub known locally as Lotka. It is cut above ground to encourage regrowth, then delivered to the papermakers, a 2 to 3 day walk down from the mountains. Lotka paper is prized for its durability and texture. Hand painted batik fabric attached, with matching envelope and blank inside. Colours may vary slightly. 16.5 cm high, 12 cm wide.

  New SADLE, Nepal

New SADLE (New Skill and Development Learning Experience) provides free medical treatment, food, housing, and education to ex-leprosy and ex-polio affected social outcasts in Kathmandu. Their employment and reintegration program promotes self respect and dignity. WFTO member (Fair Trade Group Nepal).

entry.title: Snowman & Christmas Tree Garland
entry.summary:
Vendor: UPAVIM, Guatemala
Type: each
Price: 19.95

Back in stock mid-November 2020. These cheerful Guatemalan snowmen add a festive touch to your home. Two stuffed, felted snowmen trimmed with Guatemalan fabric accents and three stuffed, felted Christmas trees are are strung on a sparkly beaded garland with hanging loops at both ends. The garland measures 52" L. The snowman and trees are approx. 4" H and the trees hearts are 3" W. Handmade and fair trade. Garland: 52"L Glass and plastic sparkly beads, bead eyes and Guatemalan fabric accents. Handmade and Fair Trade!

  UPAVIM, Guatemala

UPAVIM is a group of 65 marginalized women artisans living near Guatemala City. Fair Trade sales provide sustainable incomes, a medical and dental clinic, an elementary school and daycare, 625 school scholarships, and much more. FTF member.

entry.title: Heart Garland
entry.summary:
Vendor: UPAVIM, Guatemala
Type: each
Price: 16.00

Love is in the air - literally! Make your home (and hearts) festive on Valentine's Day or every day with our reversible String of Hearts Garland that is sure to liven up any room! Each heart is made from traditional Guatemalan fabric and they all hang from a satin cord. As always, Handmade and Fair Trade!

  • Garland is 56" L
  • Hearts are 3" W x 3" H
  • 100% Cotton

15 cm H

  UPAVIM, Guatemala

UPAVIM is a group of 65 marginalized women artisans living near Guatemala City. Fair Trade sales provide sustainable incomes, a medical and dental clinic, an elementary school and daycare, 625 school scholarships, and much more. FTF member.

entry.title: Star Ornament
entry.summary:
Vendor: Global Mamas, Ghana
Type: each
Price: 10.95

Beads made from recycled glass. Adinkra bead hand painted with the symbol for Gye Nyame. Tag defines the meaning which symbolizes the belief that God is above all and reflects Ghana's spiritual roots. Wire framework and loop for hanging. Raffia tie.

Handmade in Ghana by Global Mamas.

Bead making has been a thriving industry in West Africa since the sixteenth century and the Krobo area of Ghana is known as one of the beadmaking hubs. The handcrafting of beads using clay molds and ovens has changed little over the centuries as the family craft is passed down through the generations. In Krobo, beads are handmade from all kinds of recycled glass such as bottles, jars, and broken windows. Krobo beads are widely known for their vibrant colours and high level of craftsmanship.

      Global Mamas, GHANA

Global Mamas provides women in Ghana, West Africa the opportunity to improve their standard of living with dignity by promoting their traditional crafts. Proceeds go directly to the women participating in the Global Mamas Cooperative (all are paid over 10 times the minimum wage) and to support other non-profit programs. WFTO and FTF member.
